resources.string: Press play to start the game, you can pause or skip tutorial from here.

This tile represents a single passenger. The figure on the top left is the amount of money that the passenger is with. The amount below is how much the passenger is supposed to pay. The patience signifies how long time is left until the passenger alights. The background changes to let you know passengers\' statuses; green, yellow and red signifies their patience levels while purple means the passenger is settled. Every passenger should be settled before they alight or your health will be continually depleted by the passenger. Settled passengers\' background is fixed to purple, not minding their alight time

This bottom toolbar contains the power up button and the wallet system, it can be swiped left and right on smaller displays. To select 30, press 10 followed by a 20. The numbers in the brackets signify how many of that denomination remains. You can view your wallet selection just beside the clear selection button (marked X). Above the clear selection button is the power up button. Press it to activate your power up. The number of power ups remaining is displayed in on the button.

The tool bar on top shows your play time on the left, your current health in the middle and your current score on the right. You can pause the game with the pause button that is beside your current score.
This is a passenger. The amount you\'ll receive is on the top left, the amount the passenger should pay is on the top right.
You now owe the passenger change, as indicated on top left of the passenger, the passenger doesn\'t owe you.
This is your wallet, your money is split into denominations. The quantity you have is on the top right.
This is your power up, button. The quantity you have is shown on the button. Tap this button any time you want to activate a power up.

Finally, this is the total time of your current game play, the higher you play the more your reputation. Power ups help to last longer. Beside this is your health bar, once your health bar is completely finished, your game will end. You can replay this tutorial from the help menu in the main page.
Progress will not be saved, continue?
This is Lekki, things aren\'t as tough as they ought to be. You\'ll encounter a lot of soft mission here.
VI isn\'t as easy as Lekki, but it\'s not the toughest too. Missions are tougher now.
CMS is tough, that is what I can tell you. You need to be a real \'agbero\' to scale through
If you thought that you\'ve seen tough, you must be joking. Welcome to Ikeja, only those from the streets can scale through.
Prevents the passenger\'s patience from reducing. Driver will encounter road traffic for a %1$d seconds. Be careful, those who have run out of patience will still deplete your health.
Crack some jokes. This increases the patience of all your passengers for %1$d seconds.
Speeds things up a bit. settled passengers give 2x more score, angry passengers take 2x more health. This lasts %1$d seconds and doesn\'t affect play time.
Causes driver to drive slowly so you can buy some puff puff. It regenerates your health for %1$d seconds.
Driver finds some change at the Petrol Station. Splits %1$d notes in the largest denomination across other smaller denominations. Your passengers will definitely be angry for the time wasted.
You do not have enough money
